Army Department, to Secretary of State for India.29tfi Juty 1919. (Received 30th.).10229. 29th July. No. 79.Part I. (1) Some interference with mails and convoys is being experienced in Dir from parties of local bad characters. Otherwise situation on Chitral, Bajaur and Mohmand border is normal.(2) Dakka reports that dispersal of Basswal lashkar continues, those remaining are mostly local tribesmen. Agents report that no Afghan preparations for continuing the war appear to be in progress on Dakka front.(3) Three Mahsnd raiding parties are reported in the neighbourhood of Tank.(4) Lashkar with transport animals estimated at 700 to 800 men reported moving from vicinity of ICapip to three miles south-east of Fort Sandeman. Lashkar are picqueting hills on Fort Sandeman ridge. Some sniping of post has occurred.(5) Herat Agent reports, 20th July, that no troop movements have taken place that direction.Part II. Nil. Para. 5 not communicated to Press.
